refnamediv.refpurpose: Similar to prints but prints to a file.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Similar to prints but prints to a file.

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: "string" -- the text string to be printed. Can be up to 8192 characters and must be in double quotes.
ival1, ival2, ... (optional) -- The i-rate values to be printed. These are specified in string with the standard C value specifier (%f, %d, etc.) in the order given.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: fprints is similar to the prints opcode except it outputs to a file. For more information about output formatting, please look at printks's documentation.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para:
Here is an example of the fprints opcode. It uses the file fprints.csd.
Example of the fprints opcode.
See the sections Real-time Audio and Command Line Flags for more information on using command line flags.
This example will generate a file called my.sco. It should contain a line like this:
;Generated score by ma++
